channel.title: Paypal scams
channel.description:
Ok, well i hear a lot about paypal favor the buyer always, and pretty much fuck over the sellers (in a virtual items case)
a game called Conquer online have an item shop (cash shop) and well im thinking of spending 200$ on shit, then making a dispute and say i never made that transaction (aparently they have to refund your money) then the game conpany will pretty much try track my accounts/items down and ban, but not if i play my cards right. i think i can benefit and evade the penalty. (for example, using an internet cafe when i order the shit, ordering it on newb characters, selling the items for money, dropping the money and picking it up on a diff char thats never touched the ip of the internet cafe one.
would this work or not?

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:28, topic:231807”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=305339.msg2448625#msg2448625 date=1221867575]
But doesn’t the fact that I did it in the US have anything to do with it? Or can I just scam all foreign countries for thousands of dollars with no consequences?
[/quote]
That will get consequences, scaming is not legal in US or most of the country in the world. (Maybe legal in Netherland, but I don’t know)[/quote]

Haha, how the hell would scamming be legal in the Netherlands?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

BloodRayne:

Anyways, I think the fact that all the gold companies are based out of Asia has something to do with them not coming over here for a small claims court session.

No, it’s because if the company is based in a country where it isn’t illegal to do so, then American law has nothing to do with it(I thought that would be pretty obvious).

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:23, topic:231807”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=305339.msg2448460#msg2448460 date=1221862153]

You relies that, that is illegal and if they find you you can go to jail for fraud.

Nobody touches you for less than $500. Seriously. I used to rip off gold companies for RS, and I made hundreds of millions for free :]

I guess it makes sense though, cause the truth is, it costs more than $500 to get someone investigated/court fees, and all that legal crapola.
[/quote]

Not really, people go to small claims court all the time for amounts much lower then 500. That’s why small claims exists…[/quote]

your right, overall its not smart to do fraud no matter how low the money is and then admitting it on the web

Read full topic

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:18, topic:231807”]But, if i say it wasnt me who did this transaction meaning someone keylogged me or some shit, they have to refund my money as far as i know, yeh Conquer get screwed over, but thats when they have to act.

On there website, it says Please make sure you have permission from the money payer before buying from here, failing to do so could cause you an account ban.

They have been screwed over so many times like this before, they upped there security and only allow a certain amount of items to be brought over a certain amount of time (so some guy cant just come in with 2k$ buy shit and fuck them over)

200$ is the max you can pay for a new person buying stuff.

I’m going to do this, Before i thought of this idea i was toying with the idea of spending about 100$ USD there legit, so if i do get screwed over. ill still get what i paid for, ill be a little angry, but not so much cause i still get what i was gonna get.[/quote]
If you got keylogged that is not their fault, Paypal or your bank do I think have to pay you.
And I doubt any of them will pay back the 200$.

Read full topic

They have been screwed over so many times like this before, they upped there security and only allow a certain amount of items to be brought over a certain amount of time (so some guy cant just come in with 2k$ buy shit and fuck them over)

200$ is the max you can pay for a new person buying stuff.

I’m going to do this, Before i thought of this idea i was toying with the idea of spending about 100$ USD there legit, so if i do get screwed over. ill still get what i paid for, ill be a little angry, but not so much cause i still get what i was gonna get.

Read full topic

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:14, topic:231807”][quote author=davidude36 link=topic=305339.msg2447616#msg2447616 date=1221811776]
If you think paypal will favour a small time paypal buyer over a huge business then you are wrong my friend.
[/quote]

Actually, they do. Every time. Paypals protection always favours the buyer.

HOWEVER - this plan will not work, unless you reverse the charges on your card. Paypal buyer protection does not cover virtual/intangible products or services, only physical products.[/quote]
That rigth, and Conquer online will not be hurt in this case if xEnt says he never did the transaction, then there is Paypal or his bank that must pay back, if they belive him.

And I don’t think this would work.

Read full topic

If you think paypal will favour a small time paypal buyer over a huge business then you are wrong my friend.

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:11, topic:231807”][quote author=poopy4231 link=topic=305339.msg2447231#msg2447231 date=1221787498]
im a highly repped seller and buyer off keyhunt.com and a lot of 14 year old kids like you scam people and reverse the money on their daddys credit card after making the payment. but just to answer your question you probably wont get caught policewise… idk about your parents cuz they will see on their credit card a charge then a reversal…
[/quote]
Your an idiot, im 19 and use my own bank/paypal.

This plan is illegal obviously, but if worst comes to worst (the cops at my door) ill fuckin say my ex girlfriend ordered the shit without me knowing, simple. Makes it valid that that is now a unauthorized deal, i get my shit back and then Conquer game try and ban me etc.

Im aware of how many people use paypal to fuck me over, i was one of those unfortunant ones who got owned when selling party hats on Sythe.org, met some faggot who used a credit card, brought my blue for 950$ USD few days later it was gone.[/quote]

One thing you are confessing to all this they can just go on your computer and find records.

Read full topic

item.title: Paypal scams
item.dc:creator: @moparscape4lifez moparscape4lifez
item.description:
@moparscape4lifez wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:1, topic:231807”]Ok, well i hear a lot about paypal favor the buyer always, and pretty much fuck over the sellers (in a virtual items case)

a game called Conquer online have an item shop (cash shop) and well im thinking of spending 200$ on shit, then making a dispute and say i never made that transaction (aparently they have to refund your money) then the game conpany will pretty much try track my accounts/items down and ban, but not if i play my cards right. i think i can benefit and evade the penalty. (for example, using an internet cafe when i order the shit, ordering it on newb characters, selling the items for money, dropping the money and picking it up on a diff char thats never touched the ip of the internet cafe one.

would this work or not?[/quote]

This idea is not new… its been used for ages in many many mmorpgs… it works and yes you could get away with it without even using internet cafes just use a proxy. Paypal also has a very bad system… as long as you got a credit card or bank account on paypal no matter if paypal has 0.00$ on your balance… it will just go negative and if you don’t own the paypal you shouldn’t care…

Now the trick with getting away with it… is not just transferring from newb chars over to main that got me banned… but I figured out a way to trick the system but it requires EXTREME amount of trust… in a game I played we had a guild/clan/squadron/team thing. We would just drop the item and pick it up on different accounts (trades were logged and are logged in many games…) but whats the chances of logging items that are dropped that would be a extremely huge log file. Anyways yah just kept dropping and picking up on different accounts the gamemasters of the game right away would just been like ah this refunder must of sold it already to some legit players… no point in taking it away from a legit player… he will complain he lost a item he payed game money for… so the whole thing is flawed like that…

I got banned cuz when I figured out the system works by just clicking checkout button… I did it over 100 times charging the company 5000$ or more… they obviously had to pay back some huge fees and they were really pissed off… I had a shit load of exp cards and the game had shared banks… so I shared with a few friends… I transfered over the shit to random banks… and still only i got banned cuz of my ip… didn’t know about ips back then.

Also one huge flaw… when you login your noob your ip will get logged and your main will instantly get banned later… to proxy exe games you gotta use a vps they could be remote assistance or vnc but you gotta download the game on them so make sure its a fast VPS.

You could proxy games without vps using freecaps… but it only works on some games not all… those that got hack protection game guards u cant use it on that… freecaps uses proxies u find on google http ones to change ur ip.

But well u could go to hell for doing this… lol thats about the only downside to this method.

Read full topic
